{"data": {"production":{"id":"raw","production_title":"Raw","production_status":2,"production_type":null,"production_desc":"

Everyone in Justine's family is a vet. And a vegetarian. At 16, she's a brilliant and promising student. When she starts at veterinary school, she enters a decadent, merciless and dangerously seductive world. During the first week of hazing rituals, desperate to fit in whatever the cost, she strays from her family principals when she eats raw meat for the first time.<\/p>

Justine will soon face the terrible and unexpected consequences of her actions as her true self begins to emerge...<\/p>","in_theaters":"

Now Playing in Select Theaters<\/p>","date_release":"2017-03-10","division":"focus_world","logo":"http:\/\/focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com\/assets\/uploads\/logo_1485476273.png","rating_img":"","show_grid":1,"show_grid_filters":1,"show_in_theaters":1,"show_awards_intro":0,"meta_title":"Raw | Official Site | Trailers and Release Dates | Focus World","meta_desc":"Title: RAW, Director: Julia Ducournau, Studio: Focus World, Release Date: March 10, 2017. From one of Variety's top directors to watch in 2017 comes RAW, Julia Ducournau' s sexy and stunning directorial debut. RAW, an incredibly touching, viscerally human coming-of-age story, will be released on March 10, 2017 by Focus World, a subsidiary of Focus Features and NBC\/Universal. When a young vegetarian undergoes a carnivorous hazing ritual at vet school, an unbidden taste for meat develops with unexpected consequences.","meta_keywords":"focus features, focus world, raw, grave, julia ducournau, thriller, horror, horror-comedy, petit film, foreign film, indpendent, film, hollywood, movies, cannes, tiff, garance marillier, ella rumpf, rabah nait oufella, wild bunch, Justine, Alexia, hazing, coming-of-age, metamorphosis, french, cinema, art house, art-house, sexual awakening, gender, cronenberg, veterinary, school, Jim Williams, gothic, cannibalism, greek tragedy, joanna preiss, larent luca, bouli lanners, marion vernoux, jen des forets, julie gayet, nadia turincev, female director, women, women director, first-time director, crudo, grave,Cannes, Toronto International Film Festival, TIFF, SITGES, BFI London, Fantastic Fest, Monster Fest","meta_img":"http:\/\/focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com\/assets\/uploads\/prodmeta_588ba59fd5f36.jpg","facebook":"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/Rawmovie\/","twitter":"https:\/\/twitter.com\/rawmovie","instagram":"https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/rawmovie","youtube_channel":"https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/playlist?list=PLiOrpOwtIJGwAORN2nJwI_wyJjq4pu-sP","tumblr_url":"https:\/\/rawmovie.tumblr.com\/","dvd_url":"","bluray_url":"","ondemand_url":"","itunes_url":"","moviefone_id":"raw\/20084971","movietickets_id":"231730","fandango_id":"vntg-raw_198514","related_film_title":"Nocturnal Animals","related_film_url":"http:\/\/focusfeatures.com\/nocturnalanimals","related_film_thumb":"http:\/\/focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com\/assets\/uploads\/thumb_5818f323d234e.jpg","code_head":"","code_body_top":"
